name: Nitty Gritty The World Ain't Ready CD

Has such hits as “Hittin Bitches in the Face with Pans” “South Jersey Phenoms” and “80’s Night” TAKE A LISTEN TO SOME OF THE SONGS www.getgritty.com With an Introduction by ECW’s own Blue Meanie and a hot ass rap by Michael Ray Bower aka Donkeylips! BUY NOW!!! GET ‘EM WHILE THEY’RE HOT!!!

name: Wasted Apples Movie
description: This is our first flick in a series we call the Station Trilogy. The story occurs the night of High School graduation. A group of friends are celebrating their first night after High School. It begins in a parking lot where they all meet up before the big party. Breaking up with your girlfriends, building time machines, pooping you pants, finding out you’re gay. These are some of the situations in which this group of friends find themselves. It’s a story to which anyone can relate. A story of today’s kids, a story of growing up, friendship, life, and fucking shit up. more info and trailers check http://www.wastedapples.com/WA.html It’s a VHS tape… OLD SCHOOL HOMIES!!!

name: Small Kid; Tank Top
description: Our Second flick in the Station Trilogy. The beach plus the station crew makes for one crazy time. Whether it’s drinking pee, watching kid’s freak out or listening in on a few girl stories, laugher is sure to follow. The station crew embarks on there second movie with “Small Kid; Tank Top” you learn more about the characters you feel in love with in “Wasted Apples”. Small Kid goes in more detail with Alex’s ongoing trouble with woman, and everybody else’s enjoyment with the ongoing trouble with woman that Alex has. This movie shows that if you have good friends any situation can be a good time and even more so, things aren’t always as them seem. The Station Trilogy’s second movie bases its self on the summer, the shore house, the story between the beginning and the ending. When you finish watching this movie it will make you appreciate what’s really important in your life. Remember you crazy kitties, it’s VHS!

name: Here's to Yesterday
description: YOU TOTALLY GUESSED IT!!! THE THIRD MOVIE IN THE STATION TRILOGY! HOLY SHIT! In an era where movie titles have nothing to do with the movie itself, Here’s To Yesterday says it all. The third and final movie of the Station Trilogy, Here’s To Yesterday stands alone as a divine entity. Based on the true lives of the Station Crew, this movie portrays, in its simplest form, growing up. The group, being so individual, understands this, but discovers what will keep them together; the past. This discovery is brought about by a project that one of the characters (John) must complete for a summer course at college. Becoming the narrator of the movie, John weaves you in and out of lives of all of the different friends in the Station Crew. One being the battle of Charm vs. Charm; the never-ending fight between Tommy and his friend and foe Albert, that is apparently stealing Tommy’s women using some sort of magical charm. This movie touches home with those that have had to face the lurking fear of growing up and separating from their life-long friends. more info and trailers check http://www.wastedapples.com/yesterday.html The format is VHS, Dawgs!
